<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: byte[] packet = new byte[512];
byte[] enccmdBytes = enccmd.getBytes("UTF-8");
byte[] randomBytes = new byte[4];
new Random().nextBytes(randomBytes);
System.arraycopy(new byte[]{0x0C, 0x15, 0x33, 0x00}, 0, packet, 0, 4);
System.arraycopy(randomBytes, 0, packet, 4, 4);
System.arraycopy(new byte[38], 0, packet, 8, 38);
byte[] lenBytes = ByteBuffer.allocate(2).order(ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN).putShort((short) enccmdBytes.length).array();
System.arraycopy(lenBytes, 0, packet, 46, 2);
System.arraycopy(enccmdBytes, 0, packet, 48, enccmdBytes.length);
Arrays.fill(packet, 48 + enccmdBytes.length, 512, (byte) 0x00);
DatagramPacket datagramPacket = new DatagramPacket(packet, packet.length, InetAddress.getByName("your_ip_address"), your_port_number);
<<<explanation>>>: Here is the Java translation of the given Python code. It creates a byte array called "packet" with a length of 512. It then populates the packet array with the required data, including the random bytes, encoded command, and padding. Finally, it creates a DatagramPacket object using the packet array, the destination IP address, and the port number.
